# DaemonEye

> Security-focused, privilege-separated process monitoring system with SQL-driven detection, tamper-evident audit logging, and cross-platform support

DaemonEye implements a three-component architecture (procmond, daemoneye-agent, daemoneye-cli) with strict privilege separation. This index provides AI assistants with normative specifications, development guidelines, and operational patterns. Start with Documentation for orientation, then Specifications for requirements, and Configuration for deployment guidance.

## Documentation

- [AGENTS](AGENTS.md): AI assistant rules of engagement and precedence hierarchy
- [Contributing](docs/src/contributing.md): Contribution guidelines and development processes
- [Getting Started](docs/src/getting-started.md): Initial setup and quick start workflow
- [Introduction](docs/src/introduction.md): High-level product introduction and context
- [Pricing](docs/src/pricing.md): Pricing model and tier summary
- [Project Overview](docs/src/project-overview.md): Component overview and value proposition
- [README](README.md): Project overview, goals, and quick start
- [SECURITY](SECURITY.md): Security policy, reporting process, and vulnerability disclosure
- [Security Overview](docs/src/security.md): Security model, threat considerations, and controls summary
- [Testing Overview](docs/src/testing.md): Testing strategy, tiers, tooling, and quality gates

## Specifications

- [ADR IPC Interprocess](spec/adr-ipc-interprocess.md): Architecture decision record for interprocess crate migration
- [API Reference](docs/src/api-reference.md): API reference index

- [Business Tier](docs/src/technical/business-tier.md): Business tier technical extensions and features

- [Core API](docs/src/api-reference/core-api.md): Core API concepts and interface reference
- [Core Monitoring](docs/src/technical/core-monitoring.md): Core monitoring capabilities and requirements
- [Development Guidelines](.kiro/steering/development.md): Development workflows, commands, and coding conventions
- [Enterprise Tier](docs/src/technical/enterprise-tier.md): Enterprise tier advanced capabilities
- [Feature Tiers](docs/src/architecture/feature-tiers.md): Feature differentiation across Free/Business/Enterprise tiers
- [IPC Implementation](docs/src/technical/ipc-implementation.md): IPC implementation details and patterns
- [Performance Standards](.kiro/steering/performance.md): Performance targets and resource management requirements
- [Product](.kiro/steering/product.md): Product feature specifications and tier definitions

- [Query Pipeline](docs/src/technical/query-pipeline.md): Query pipeline architecture and execution

- [System Architecture](docs/src/architecture/system-architecture.md): Core system architecture and data flows
- [Tech Stack](.kiro/steering/tech.md): Technology stack decisions and enforced requirements
- [Technical](docs/src/technical.md): Technical topics index for deeper implementation areas
- [Testing Standards](.kiro/steering/testing.md): Testing strategy and quality assurance requirements

## Examples

- [Collector-Core](collector-core/README.md): Reusable collection infrastructure framework with unified event model
- [DaemonEye EventBus](daemoneye-eventbus/README.md): Cross-platform IPC event bus with pub/sub messaging and embedded broker
